item.title: 7 RAREST pics of mysterious universe by NASA - India.com
item.description:
7 RAREST pics of mysterious universe by NASA

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India.com

This article highlights seven rare photographs of the universe captured by NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing the beauty and mystery of our cosmos.

  • Asteroid Dimorphos captured on December 19, 2022.
  • ‘Spoke Season’ on Saturn observed from approximately 850 million miles away.
  • Image of the bright spiral galaxy MCG-01-24-014, located about 275 million light-years away.
  • UGC 8091 showcasing billions of glittering stars, resembling a snow globe.
  • Spiral galaxy NGC 6951 featuring bright blue spiral arms.
  • Rare Radio Galaxy NGC 612 exhibiting vibrant orange and blue streaks.
  • G35.2-0.7N region captured in stunning detail.
“These images not only provide scientific insight but also inspire awe about the universe we live in.”

The article emphasizes the importance of such images in understanding the universe's vastness and complexities, revealing both scientific and artistic marvels.

item.title: Virat Kohli, Sam Konstas’ shoulder-bump incident inspires Kerala Police's unique road safety advisory - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kerala Police’s advisory on road safety, which uses footage of Virat Kohli bumping into Sam Konstas’ shoulder, has left social media users chuckling.

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The on-field shoulder bump between Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas has inspired an innovative road safety advisory from the Kerala Police, cleverly repurposing viral footage to convey an important message about road safety.

  • The footage shows Kohli bumping into Konstas during a cricket match, leading to a humorous yet serious traffic safety campaign.
  • The Kerala Police emphasized the importance of following traffic rules through the video, stating: “It's okay to be ‘King’. Follow traffic rules. While keeping yourself safe, keep others safe too.”
  • The campaign aims to convey crucial road safety messages through clever visual metaphors, utilizing the bump to illustrate dangers on the road.
“I think emotions got to both of us...but it happens in cricket,” - Sam Konstas on the shoulder bump incident.

This fusion of sports and road safety awareness has resonated well with social media users, emphasizing how impactful public safety messages can be when presented in creative ways.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test Day 5 Live Updates: Kohli And Rohit Flop, Play Resumes Post Lunch - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test Day 5 Live Updates: DRS Drama Sees Jaiswal Survive, Australia In Disbelief

Date & Source: Not specified

Live updates from the fifth day of the 4th Test between India and Australia, highlighting the DRS controversy involving Indian player Yashasvi Jaiswal.

  • Moment of controversy as Jaiswal survives a DRS decision, causing disbelief among Australian players.
  • Australia's response to the decision during the crucial moments of the match.
  • Key performances by players impacting the flow of the game.
“We thought we had him, but it just didn't go our way.” - Australian team member

The unfolding situation underscores the tension and drama that the DRS system can bring to high-stakes cricket matches.

item.title: ‘Pilot declared mayday’: What caused the Jeju Air plane crash in South Korea? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Pilot declared mayday’: What caused the Jeju Air plane crash in South Korea?

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A Jeju Air flight from Bangkok to South Korea crashed during landing, resulting in 179 deaths and only two survivors being rescued.

  • The plane was warned of a bird strike during its first landing attempt.
  • The pilot declared a “mayday” and attempted a belly landing.
  • All 175 passengers and four crew members died; only two flight attendants survived.
  • Investigations are examining a potential bird strike and adverse weather as causes.
  • Both flight data and cockpit voice recorders have been recovered.
“It really has to be a series of catastrophic events that led to such a high loss of life,” - Philip Butterworth-Hayes, aviation consultant.

This tragic incident has brought to light the aviation safety measures and the potential hazards involved in flight operations.

item.title: Kangana Ranaut says hard-working women in Himachal are ‘equal or better looking’ than her, Preity Zinta, Yami Gautam - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kangana Ranaut Praises Hard-Working Himachali Women

Date: Dec 30, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Kangana Ranaut, MP of Mandi and actor, highlighted the beauty and hard work of women in Himachal Pradesh, stating they deserve more recognition.

  • Kangana took to Instagram to share her thoughts and pictures alongside fellow actresses Preity Zinta and Yami Gautam.
  • She emphasized that women working in the fields are equally or more beautiful and deserve attention.
  • Ranaut has also spoken out in support of Blake Lively amidst controversies in the entertainment industry.
  • She recently faced issues with the release of her biopic on Indira Gandhi titled 'Emergency.'
“When I go to Himachal and see our women equally or better looking than us work tirelessly in the fields... I feel they can definitely do with some hype.”

This statement underscores Ranaut's appreciation for local women and calls for their recognition beyond the glamour of the film industry.

Stock Market Today: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On Dec. 30

Date: 30 Dec 2024

Source: NDTV Profit

As traders prepare for today’s market, most indices in Asia-Pacific are trending lower. Key insights include movements in stock prices, oil and gold rates, and domestic currency fluctuations.

“The Indian rupee weakened sharply... marking its steepest single-day decline since February 2023.”

item.title: Platinum Guild rides double-digit surge as Young India seeks more than ‘Just Gold’ | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Platinum Guild rides double-digit surge as Young India seeks more than ‘Just Gold’

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Mint

India’s fascination with gold is legendary, but platinum is quickly carving out its own space, especially among young consumers who want jewellery to mean more than a mere “store of value.”

  • High levels of awareness and consideration for platinum among consumers.
  • Sustained double-digit growth in platinum sales.
  • Expansion of platinum marketing efforts into tier-2 and tier-3 towns.
  • Consumer marketing director Sujala Martis discusses evolving consumer mindsets.
  • Focus on the emotive aspects of platinum compared to gold.
“Platinum is seen as a more meaningful choice among the younger generation, reflecting personal expression rather than just investment.”

The growing trend of young consumers seeking more from their jewellery indicates a significant shift in marketing for the platinum industry aimed at emotional connections.

item.title: 'Pushpa 2' box office collection day 25 (Updated Live): The Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna starrer main - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Pushpa 2 box office collection day 25 (Updated Live)

Published on: October 23, 2023 | Source: Latest Cinema News

Pushpa 2, featuring Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna, has shown remarkable consistency at the box office, earning Rs 16 crore on its fourth Sunday in India.

  • The film has maintained steady growth over 25 days.
  • Pushpa 2's performance reflects its strong audience reception.
  • Allu Arjun's star power continues to drive ticket sales.
“The film's sustained growth shows that it has resonated well with audiences,” a box office analyst stated.

This continued success is a testament to the film's quality and the star cast's popularity.

item.title: NASA Confirms: Parker Probe Survives 'Touching Sun' in Record-Breaking Flyby - ScienceAlert
item.description:
NASA Confirms: Parker Probe Survives 'Touching Sun' in Record-Breaking Flyby

Date: December 24th, 2024

Source: Universe Today

The Parker Solar Probe made its closest approach to the Sun, passing just 6 million km above the surface and achieving a velocity of about 692,000 km/h. NASA confirmed that the probe successfully transmitted a beacon tone after the flyby.

  • The Parker Probe broke the previous distance record set by Helios 2.
  • It became the fastest human-made object, reaching speeds of around 692,000 km/h.
  • It conducted science operations during close passes to enhance our understanding of solar wind origins.
  • Its journey began with gravity-assist maneuvers involving Venus.
  • The probe's carbon foam shield protects it from extreme temperatures in the solar corona.
"Flying this close to the Sun is a historic moment in humanity's first mission to a star..." - Nicky Fox, NASA Associate Administrator

The Parker Solar Probe continues to provide critical data that could transform our understanding of solar phenomena and their effects on space weather.

item.title: Jimmy Carter, 39th US President and winner of Nobel Prize, dies at 100 - The Indian Express
item.description:
Jimmy Carter, the 39th and longest-lived US President, dies at 100

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Former US President Jimmy Carter has passed away aged 100, marking the end of a significant era in American politics as he was the longest-lived president in history.

  • Carter served as President from 1977 to 1981, facing numerous foreign policy challenges.
  • He was defeated in the 1981 re-election bid by Ronald Reagan.
  • His foundation, the Carter Center, announced his passing, citing various health ailments, including melanoma.
  • In 2002, he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for his global humanitarian efforts.
  • The Carter Center monitored around 113 elections worldwide, advocating for democracy and human rights.
“To all of the young people in this nation and for anyone in search of what it means to live a life of purpose and meaning – the good life, study Jimmy Carter, a man of principle, faith, and humility.” - President Joe Biden

A state funeral has been ordered for Jimmy Carter in Washington, as recognized by President Biden.

item.title: Trade Setup for December 30: Can the Nifty scale 24,000 during the final two sessions of 2024? - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Nifty's December 30 Trading Outlook: Can It Reach 24,000?

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty index opened positively but faced resistance near the 23,900-24,000 range, ultimately closing higher at 23,813.40. Auto sales data will be critical for market direction as we transition into the new year.

  • Nifty closed up 63 points at 23,813.40 after reaching 23,938.85 earlier in the session.
  • Total of 32 Nifty stocks recorded gains with M&M, Trent, and Adani Ports leading the way.
  • Technical analysts highlight a potential resistance zone at 24,000-24,200; immediate support noted at 23,650.
  • Despite positive returns, selling pressure from heavyweight stocks remains a concern with crucial support at 23,500.
  • The Nifty Bank index shows signs of a potential reversal with a close at 51,311.30.
“A decisive breach below the recent swing low of 23,500 could intensify selling pressure.” - Ajit Mishra, Religare Broking

Market forces such as foreign institutional selling and currency fluctuations are key to the Nifty's direction heading into the new year.

item.title: South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates: Biden offers US assistance to South Korea after plane crash - The Indian Express
item.description:
South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates

Date: January 1, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

In an emergency meeting on Sunday, South Korea’s acting President Choi Sang-mok declared a national mourning period until January 4 following the deadly plane crash at Muan International Airport that killed 179. All on board except two crew members are feared dead as a plane carrying 181 passengers and six crew on a flight from Bangkok to South Korea’s Muan International Airport crashed and burst into flames early Sunday.

  • The crash occurred at around 9 am local time during the plane's landing.
  • The flight was a Jeju Air Boeing 737-800 carrying 175 passengers and 6 crew members.
  • Most of the passengers are believed to be South Koreans, with two Thai nationals on board.
  • Acting President Choi Sang-mok expressed condolences and ordered all-out rescue efforts.
  • The crash site has been declared a special disaster zone.
The government would like to offer its sincere condolences to the bereaved families and will do its best to recover from this accident and prevent a recurrence. - Choi Sang-mok

The incident has raised significant concerns about aviation safety and has prompted US assistance offers.

item.title: Oppo Find N5: Key specifications leaked ahead of expected 2025 launch - Notebookcheck.net
item.description:
Oppo Find N5: Key specifications leaked ahead of expected 2025 launch

Date: 2024-12-29 Source: Notebookcheck

The Oppo Find N5 is anticipated to launch in 2025, following leaks revealing numerous specifications for the foldable smartphone.

  • Expected specifications include a 6.4-inch external display and an 8-inch inner display with 2K resolution.
  • Camera setup may consist of three 50MP lenses (primary, ultra-wide, and telephoto).
  • Powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, the device aims for flagship performance.
  • Features a large 5,700mAh battery with fast charging capabilities.
  • Potential release after the Chinese New Year in February 2025.
"The Find N5 is expected to launch as the OnePlus Open 2 outside China."

This leak builds anticipation for the Oppo Find N5, highlighting its advanced features and expected release within the next year.

item.title: Bigg Boss 18: Sara Arfeen Khan gets eliminated, show gets Top 10 contestants - The Times of India
item.description:
Bigg Boss 18: Sara Arfeen Khan Eliminated, Top 10 Contestants Revealed

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Bigg Boss 18 journey took a dramatic turn as Sara Arfeen Khan was evicted from the house after receiving the least number of votes, influenced by housemates' votes against her. Her elimination solidified the top 10 contestants.

  • Sara's eviction followed a controversial incident involving Karan Veer Mehra.
  • The top 10 contestants are Vivian Dsena, Rajat Dalal, Karan Veer Mehra, Avinash Mishra, Chum Darang, Shrutika Arjun, Shilpa Shirodkar, Kashish Kapoor, Eisha Singh, and Chahat Pandey.
  • The recent episode had a heated exchange between Kashish Kapoor and Avinash Mishra.

Salman Khan stated, “Angle is a big word for her, but womanizer isn’t,” emphasizing the gravity of her language.

The episode concluded with contestants celebrating Salman Khan's birthday, providing a brief break from the show's usual tension.

item.description:
Not all high-protein foods are good for your health: Here's what to know

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

This article discusses how not all high-protein foods are beneficial for health, emphasizing the need for proper knowledge about them.

  • High-protein diets are popular but may not be universally healthy.
  • Some protein sources can lead to adverse health effects.
  • A detailed understanding of protein types is crucial for making health-conscious choices.
"Not all high-protein foods are created equal."

In conclusion, being selective about protein sources can contribute to better health outcomes.

item.title: Baby John Box Office Day 4: Varun Dhawan's Film Earns ₹23.90 Crore, Faces Heat From Pushpa 2 - News18
item.description:
Baby John Box Office Day 4: Varun Dhawan's Film Earns ₹23.90 Crore

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: News18

Varun Dhawan’s film Baby John shows a modest box office recovery, collecting ₹4.25 crore on its fourth day, bringing total earnings to ₹23.90 crore despite tough competition from Pushpa 2.

  • Day 4 collection reaches ₹4.25 crore.
  • Total domestic earnings stand at ₹23.90 crore.
  • The film debuted with ₹11.25 crore but faced a steep decline.
  • Saturday’s recovery is the first positive sign after significant drops in previous days.
  • Pushpa 2 continues to dominate with ₹12.5 crore on the same day.
“The plot feels stretched, with a sluggish first half that echoes Akshay Kumar’s Rowdy Rathore.”

Despite ups and downs, Baby John remains in a competitive box office fight, and its future performance will be closely watched amidst ongoing releases.

item.title: Experts question ‘bird strike’ as reason behind South Korea plane crash that killed 179 | Top updates - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Experts question ‘bird strike’ as reason behind South Korea plane crash that killed 179

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The tragic Jeju Air flight 7C2216 crash has raised significant questions regarding the actual cause, with experts disputing the likelihood of a bird strike leading to the aircraft's malfunction.

  • The plane was landing at Muan International Airport when it crashed, resulting in the death of 179 people.
  • Experts argue that a bird strike could not have solely caused the malfunctioning of the landing gear.
  • Survivors of the crash are stable and conscious but the majority of passengers have not been identified.
  • The South Korean government declared a period of national mourning following the incident.
“At this point there are a lot more questions than we have answers.” - Gregory Alegi, aviation expert

The ongoing investigation into the crash continues as authorities examine the factors that contributed to this tragic event.

item.title: Companies News Today Live Updates on December 29, 2024: Reliance pulls out an old video of a very young Mukesh Ambani from archives for Jamnagar refinery celebrations | Watch | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Companies News Today Live Updates on December 29, 2024: Reliance pulls out an old video of a very young Mukesh Ambani from archives for Jamnagar refinery celebrations | Watch

Date: December 29, 2024
Source: LiveMint

Reliance Industries commemorated the 25th anniversary of its Jamnagar refinery by sharing an old video featuring a young Mukesh Ambani, highlighting the company's historical significance in the petroleum industry.

  • Reliance posted an old video of a young Mukesh Ambani to celebrate the Jamnagar refinery's 25th anniversary.
“Stay ahead of the curve with the latest insights from the corporate world,” states the article.

This celebration highlights the continued impact of Reliance's Jamnagar refinery on India's petroleum sector over the past 25 years.

item.title: Reliance pulls out an old video of a very young Mukesh Ambani from archives for Jamnagar refinery celebrations | Watch | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Reliance Celebrates 25 Years of Jamnagar Refinery with Throwback Video of Mukesh Ambani

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Reliance Industries commemorated the 25th anniversary of its Jamnagar refinery by sharing an archival video of a young Mukesh Ambani, emphasizing the refinery's significant impact and the vision of his father, Dhirubhai Ambani.

  • Reliance posted a nostalgic video on X, featuring Mukesh Ambani at the Jamnagar refinery.
  • Ambani spoke about Dhirubhai Ambani's vision of creating world-class infrastructure.
  • The refinery, operational since December 28, 1999, now produces 1.4 million barrels of oil per day.
  • The total investment for the refinery reached $3.5 billion.
  • The facility has dramatically reduced India's dependence on imported refined petroleum while increasing exports.
“Jamnagar has demonstrated unquestionable to the world that if we can dream it, we can do it.” - Mukesh Ambani

As Reliance Industries looks to the future, it aims to reach its Net Zero emission targets by 2035 for the Jamnagar refinery.

item.title: From lathicharge to water cannons: Bihar police crackdown on protesting BPSC aspirants - The Times of India
item.description:
Bihar Police Use Force Against BPSC Aspirants Protests

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Times of India

Protests by Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) aspirants escalated as police employed water cannons and lathi charges to disperse crowds demanding exam reforms.

  • Protests arose from grievances over the BPSC examination process and calls for transparency.
  • Police responded with water cannons and physical force to manage the large gatherings of students.
  • Students expressed frustration with the lack of significant actions taken by the BPSC.
“We are fighting for our future; the authorities need to listen to us,” one protester stated.

This incident highlights ongoing tensions between government agencies and youth aspiring for government jobs in Bihar.

item.title: Baby John Day 5 India Box Office: Varun Dhawan's action-drama nets only Rs 4.5 crore on Sunday; at the mercy of New Year holiday - PINKVILLA
item.description:
Baby John Day 5 India Box Office: Varun Dhawan's action-drama nets only Rs 4.5 crore on Sunday; at the mercy of New Year holiday

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

Varun Dhawan's 'Baby John' is heading for a disappointing end at the box office, struggling to attract audiences despite its star cast.

  • The film collected Rs 4.5 crore on its fifth day, totaling Rs 27 crore in its extended weekend.
  • Despite a strong opening of Rs 10.75 crore, the film saw a steep drop in subsequent days.
  • Mixed audience reactions and its remake status have hindered its box office performance.
  • The film is expected to conclude its global run under Rs 75 crore, leading to significant losses for the producers.
“The audience is not in any mood to show mercy to the remake movies these days.”

In conclusion, 'Baby John' reflects the challenges faced by filmmakers with remakes in a saturated market, and its underwhelming performance indicates a need for fresh content.

item.title: Delhi police nab juvenile accused of stealing ₹16.44 lakh diamond jewellery from Karol Bagh shop - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Police Arrest Juvenile for ₹16.44 Lakh Diamond Theft

Published on: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi Police have apprehended a juvenile suspected of stealing diamond jewellery valued at ₹16.44 lakh from a shop in Karol Bagh.

  • The theft occurred on December 11 during the transportation of 10 diamond necklace sets.
  • The accused allegedly stole two diamond necklace sets and four diamond earring sets.
  • The police located the 17-year-old suspect near New Delhi railway station on December 20 following an extensive search involving analysis of CCTV footage.
  • The stolen jewellery was recovered during the suspect's confession.
  • A separate incident involved the arrest of an 18-year-old and his father for stealing gold jewellery in Ludhiana.
“During interrogation, the juvenile confessed to his involvement in the crime. The stolen jewellery was recovered from his possession,” a police officer revealed.

This case highlights ongoing concerns about thefts in urban areas and the involvement of younger individuals in such crimes.
